bib.title: Results of IndexMed GRAIL Days 2016: How to use standards to build GRAphs and mIne data for environmentaL research
bib.author: Romain David and Jean-Pierre Féral and Anne-Sophie Archambeau and David Auber and Nicolas Bailly and Cyrille Blanpain and Vincent Breton and Alrick Dias and Anna Cohen-Nabeiro and Aurélie Delavaud and Sophie Gachet and Robin Goffaux and Karina Gibert and Manuel Herrera and Dino Ienco and Romain Julliard and Julien Lecubin and Yannick Legre and Grégoire Loïs and Victor Méndez Muñoz and Jean-Charles Meunier and Isabelle Mougenot and Sophie Pamerlon and Geneviève Romier and Alison Specht and Christian Surace and Thierry Tatoni
bib.abstract: Data produced by biodiversity research projects that evaluate and monitor ‘Good Environmental Status’ have a high potential for use by stakeholders involved in [marine] environmental management. The lack of specific scientific objectives, poor organizational logic, and a characteristically disorganized collection of information leads to a decentralized data distribution, hampering environmental research. In such a heterogeneous system across different organizations and data formats, it is difficult to efficiently harmonize the outputs. There are few tools available to assist.
